definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: With his team of workers, he invented an electric light bulb, the phonograph.
sentences.chinese: 他作出了六千項發明，包括電燈泡，留聲機和油印機。

sentences.english: He ran a batch of mimeographed sheets off .
In the mountains almost everything had to be mimeographed or stone-block lithographed.
sentences.chinese: 在山區，差不多所有的材料部是油印或石印的。

sentences.english: Moreover, it has not been feasible to keep the mimeographed notes from getting fairly wide circulation.
sentences.chinese: 而且，不讓這個油印本廣泛傳播，也已經是行不通了。

sentences.english: Would you run this stencil off for me?
sentences.chinese: 請給我油印這張臘紙，好嗎？

sentences.english: The mimeograph has sat discarded in the corner for many years.
sentences.chinese: 牆角放着好幾臺長年不用的油印機。

sentences.english: Mimeographs several brands of the market share of up to 25%.
sentences.chinese: 幾個品牌的油印機市場佔有率可達25%以上。

sentences.english: Avoiding the use of VOC printing materials.
sentences.chinese: 避免使用揮發性有機化合物油印物。

sentences.english: His 6,000 inventions included the electric light bulb, the phonograph, and the mimeograph machine.
sentences.chinese: 他的六千項發明，包括電燈泡，留聲機和油印機。
用油印的方式複製備份。

definition: to set in print/to diffuse/to publish
to go to press/to submit for printing
